args: No time for idle chatter—just run!
Yo, Audric! I think those folks over there\nare being attacked by Empire goons!
Zodiark is doing all he can, but I dunno\nhow long he can hold out.
With the Empire as our opponent, we'll be\nfacing dragons ere long. We must get\nthese people to safety while we can.
This town seems to be occupied\nby the Empire...
The people who fled said these folks\nhave really been suffering.
I also sense the presence of dragons.\nAs we will likely not be able to fight them\nall off, what do you propose we do?

We buy enough time for the citizens to
escape. Notte, you guide these people.
Zodiark and I will work to disrupt the
enemy's movements.
Apologies for forcing this quickened pace\non you, but any delay on our part will\nmean encountering the imperial army.
I'm terribly sorry to slow everyone down...
Just hold on a bit longer, if you will.\nThere is a place to hide and rest\nbut a little further ahead.
Well, this is a merry band of followers\nwe've rounded up!
Such happens when we rescue all those\nin need at every stop of the way.
It's wild how they all follow Audric even\nwhen he's not sure where he's going.

They cling to hope as a drowning man
clings to wreckage. They want to believe
there is a place where they can find a
modicum of peace.
Somewhere they can find peace, huh?
Yeah, I guess if you look at it that way,\nthey don't care WHERE they're going.
You're strong and reliable, so they all\nrest a little easier with you around.
That's probably all they can think about at\nthis point.
Is our current course a good one, Audric?\nIt seems highly unlikely the Empire will\noverlook a group of this magnitude.
Is all of this not a hindrance to your goal\nof locating Cassandra and finding a way\nto travel to the past?
Perhaps, but I cannot abandon these\npeople to a grisly end. In truth, I am\nthe only hope most of them have left.
Here you go, ma'am! We're gonna have to\nwalk lots more tomorrow, so make sure\nyou eat a bunch to get your strength up.
Thank you, dear. I am so very sorry to\nbe such a burden on everyone.
Eh, we're all in the same boat.
To think I have lived to see such times...
But even knowing I am a burden,\nI still find myself clinging to life.
C'mon, cheer up! We're all gonna make\nit out of this—including you!
Ah, what a kind young thing you are.
And yet, I have now lived long enough to\nsee all that I believed in or cared about\ndashed to pieces on the rocks of fate.
My husband, my son, his wife, even my\nlittle grandchild... All dead now.
I offered my prayers to the goddess every\nday without fail, and yet in the time of my\ngreatest need, she abandoned me.
Indeed, my family was slain by the very\ndragons I begged for salvation.
I have no one left. Nothing to believe in.\nMy life is a husk, dried out and blown\naside by a cold, indifferent wind.
Please don't give up hope, ma'am.\nWe've got Audric with us now, remember?
Audric... Yes, that's right. Perhaps with\nhim around, I can find the strength to\ngo on just a little bit longer.
I heard Audric say he was leaving!
He's going someplace super far away—\na place you can only reach with magic!
You mean he's going to abandon us?!
But whatever will become of us if\nAudric is no longer with us...?
